meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a thug.
meanings.sent1: The man's thuggish appearance made others wary of him.
meanings.sent2: Her thuggish behavior at the party caused a lot of trouble.
meanings.sent3: The cat's thuggish stare at the mouse was comical.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered in a thuggish manner, ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: The thuggish graffiti on the wall was a stark reminder of the neighborhood's troubles.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a violent or aggressive manner.
meanings.sent1: The wrestler's thuggish moves intimidated his opponent.
meanings.sent2: The gang members were known for their thuggish tactics.
meanings.sent3: The thuggish barking of the small dog was more funny than scary.
meanings.sent4: The thuggish waves crashed against the shore relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: His thuggish glare made everyone in the room uneasy.

meanings.definition: Displaying a lack of morals or ethics.
meanings.sent1: The corrupt politician's thuggish actions were exposed.
meanings.sent2: The company's thuggish practices led to its downfall.
meanings.sent3: The thuggish cheating in the game was so obvious it was laughable.
meanings.sent4: The thuggish lies spun by the con artist deceived many.
meanings.sent5: The thuggish disregard for rules was evident in his reckless driving.
